[Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination): 3 mana sorcery, 2 cards.  
[Concentrate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Concentrate): 4 mana sorcery, 3 cards.  
[Tidings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tidings): 5 mana sorcery, 4 cards.  
  
[Jace's Ingenuity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Ingenuity): 5 mana instant, 3 cards.  
[Opportunity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Opportunity): 6 mana instant, 4 cards.  
  
None of these are strictly better or strictly worse than another. So choose which one you want.

posts.post_content:
Solid card! Its [sign in blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sign in blood) that's easier to splash without the life loss, but at 3 mana instead. Great card if you don't like running counterspells. Posted By: lorendorky (7/6/2012 1:54:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I don't think the comparison of this to brainstorm is a good one. Yes brainstorm let's you draw three but you only get to keep one. Good for activating abilities, not good for card advantage. Plus if you're running either a standard or modern deck you can't use brainstorm anyway. Not to mention if you're running a R/U deck and have some electromancers on the field you just got 2 cards for U. Yes it's a sorcery, but I think that's a small drawback. Definitely not a show-stopper, but I think it's a solid card. 3.5/5
posts.html:

posts.post_content: This card is terrible. first of all, it costs 3 mana to draw 2 cards. brainstorm lets you draw 3 cards for just 1 mana. second of all, it is a sorcery. when it comes to card drawing, speed is everything. how can anyone even consider this card playable? brainstorm, think twice, forbidden alchemy, blue sun's zenith, etc. are the best in my opinion.
